intro: Haplophyllum pumiliforme, commonly known as the dwarf pincushion plant, is a small, mat-forming flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant features dense clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are small, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs, giving them a soft, fuzzy appearance. Haplophyllum pumiliforme is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
